message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY

The paper discusses the use of spike-timing-dependent plasticity (STDP) in spiking neural networks (SNN) for object recognition, which falls under the category of neural networks and machine learning. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also focuses on visual recognition using convolutional neural networks (CNN), which falls under the category of computer vision, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) the second most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of deep learning and unsupervised learning, which are relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the potential applications of the proposed method in hardware solutions, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
